Posts.Content: Like fellow reader of your blog sue, I also had breast cancer and I underwent mastectomy and reconstruction. Sues words strike home as I felt exactly as she did, Jan. 2010 operated on and I also very happy to be alive and a survivor. I opted for conventional surgery after my sister in law who had cancer opted to go down the alternative route, so doing she left it to late to survive. Think wisely about the decision you make. Cancer can be beaten if caught early. I wish you all the best in your decision making. Report
Posts.Title: Is there anyone out there seeking nature's path as an alternative to or along with conventional medicine?

Posts.Content: I will not say don't worry as you will. Your over the first stage Which is not nice. Having been through it all feel for you. Once head gets around everything it will help. It seems never end- Ing, Fingers crossed for you, plenty of people on this site ready to support you. Let us know how you get on. And it's fine to rant any time. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram Recall Screening and biopsy

Posts.Content: They are quick at calling one in. I saw surgeon in under a week from mammogram. Know you will be very worried and counting down the days to your appointment. No one can predict the verdict of your mammogram as only the consultant knows. They May want to do more tests to check you out. Try to be positive. You can ring Macmillan cancer care I did and they were really great . Be nice to know how you get on. Best of luck to you. Report How did your appointment turn out if you don't mind me asking Report I was very lucky as they found two tumours heading towards each other, which resulted in mastectomy and a reconstruction.. Though it was hard and difficult to take in I am a survivor and still cancer free. It's been 5 years and 6 months now and so. gratefully it was picked up. Ty not to imagine the worse it may only be a minor thing or nothing at all. Waiting is the worst part of it. Your mind is in turmoil just now, but so many have been through this and come out the other side. Hear if you need me. Report BRAVO Janet... I am a 16 year BC survivor . with implanr 5 years after mastectomy,  (which is just now causing trouble hardening from old age ) Like me Doctors told me then, after 2nd op and malignent lymph nodes I would not last 1 year ..who says they know better than the man upstairs? Yes  MacMillan Nurses are angels indeed Bless them they helped me laugh my way back  to health... keep on surviving hon Blessings xxx  Report
Posts.Title: mammogram results

Posts.Content: I was very lucky as they found two tumours heading towards each other, which resulted in mastectomy and a reconstruction.. Though it was hard and difficult to take in I am a survivor and still cancer free. It's been 5 years and 6 months now and so. gratefully it was picked up. Ty not to imagine the worse it may only be a minor thing or nothing at all. Waiting is the worst part of it. Your mind is in turmoil just now, but so many have been through this and come out the other side. Hear if you need me. Report
Posts.Title: mammogram results

Posts.Content: Very pleased that no spread shown. Can't help regards the meds. Just want to give support. You should have a support nurse who you can contact to get the advice you need. I have been ok with my meds which is letrozole, few hot flushes but that's it. Report
Posts.Title: having problems with cough and back pain plus weight loss since i started taking tamoxifen Posted 30

Posts.Content: There are several drugs, and depending on what type of cancer you had then they will prescribe accordingly. I am now 5 years from having had cancer and all's good. Hope they get it sorted soon. Report
Posts.Title: having problems with cough and back pain plus weight loss since i started taking tamoxifen Posted 30

Posts.Content: Have you had any news yet? Report
Posts.Title: mammogram results

Posts.Content: Good luck at doctors today Report Thanks and will let you know what says Report Been told due to very low risk breast lesions and that the follow-up mammogram is mostly for observation.  GP said that often the most prudent measure for a very low risk finding is simply to 'observe' the suspected lesion on subsquent mammograms, at intervals ranging from six months to a year. Report Glad it was good news. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram results - time to get

Posts.Content: Letter in post less than a week as they found two tumours, the longer it takes then the less I would worry. I am In. Uk. If your in different country may be different. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram results - time to get

Posts.Content: Ok, if it were me, I would ring Macmillan on 0800 808 0000. 9 am til 8pm, they are up to date with all breast issues. They will give you information on what is best to do. Have had so much help from them regarding non cancer issues. If you have a breast clinic In your area ring them up for advice. I Would of asked to see a specialist and be firm about it. Over the years have had many lumps just needed draining. Try not to worry, difficult I know. Let me know how you get on please. Report
Posts.Title: breast sore lumpy and different?

Posts.Content: Ask for 2nd opinion if your not happy. It could be a swollen gland, they can do a biopsy to check it out. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram results - time to get

Posts.Content: They are at least keeping on top of it. Let me know results please. Report
Posts.Title: breast sore lumpy and different?

Posts.Content: Well if not for my mammogram having found two tumours then maybe I may not be here. They have saved lives, and all for it. The benefit for me was life. This is my opinion and proud yo support mammograms. Report
Posts.Title: First ever mammogram tomorrow terrified of it

Posts.Content: Hay, you will be fine. Thanks to my yearly mammogram found two tumours, mastectomy and reconstruction and here to tell the tail. Uncomfortable a little but nothing like you have been told. Like was said do not believe all your told. Go get it done for peace of mind. Report
Posts.Title: First ever mammogram tomorrow terrified of it

Posts.Content: Hi Tazchurch, did they give a reason ? At least it's nice to know your being checked upon. Thinking of you Report No and wouldn't on phone but GP wants to see me later today so answer then Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram results - time to get

Posts.Content: Glad it was good news. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram results - time to get

Posts.Content: Fingers crossed for 11th March. Report
Posts.Title: breast sore lumpy and different?

Posts.Content: If you have a lump, get your doctor to refer you on so it can be checked. out. Report
Posts.Title: breast sore lumpy and different?

Posts.Content: Hard not to worry, but you can get lumps which are not cancerous. I won't say the nex t few days of waiting will be easy they will not. But try to be positive, have had lumps many times and all non cancerous If really serious would of had you in straight away. Fingers crossed for you. Report 2
Posts.Title: I'm really worried I may have breast cancer!

Posts.Content: Hi, can you give me some idea where your from. Report
Posts.Title: Unsure of what to do or who to tell

Posts.Content: Hi Nicola are from England? Report
Posts.Title: breast sore lumpy and different?

Posts.Content: I think you need to get the courage up to inform your mum what you are. feeling, and get her to get you to the doctors. I am not a medical person and would not like to have a guess at what your symptoms indicate, but try not to jump to the wrong answers. Need to be seen. You will cause a lot of stress to yourself by putting things off. Not everything is cancer related. Report
Posts.Title: Unsure of what to do or who to tell

Posts.Content: So very sorry to hear that, how big was the Tumor? Did they say. This is a tough time for both of you. Will be thinking of you both. Until you get biopsy results it's a waiting game. Do let us know how you get on. Report
Posts.Title: concerned husband

Posts.Content: Hi falco, No doubt your both in turmoil right now. Try not to worry too much. They will do a biopsies and the samples will be sent off. Mammogram will show up exact situation of the cancer and they will show you what it looks like.They will talk you through everything you need to know. Not sure if you will see specialist same day or not. I Saw mine one week later when all the results were in. It depends on how your NHS works. I found the staff were great, very caring. When you see the specialist you will get all the info you need. And then they will go through treatment. I was unlucky to have 2 x 3cm tumours and both heading for each other which would make it a 10 cm tumour or more when they reached each other. My treatment was mastectomy and reconstruction. I would imagine chemotherapy would be offered to your wife. But the bright side of this is that caught early then they can sort it all. Where I live we have a place called MAGGIE'S, they are brilliant look them up on line. Also you can ring McMillan s, believe between 9 - 8pm. I have used both of these are was given so much help and info. O800 no. for Macmillan sorry do not have the rest but easily found on line. If anything can help you with let me know. Report thanks for your insight, not determined yet if it is cancer so lets hope for the best! I am from Toronto Canada. Report Sorry if jumped to wrong conclusion. From UK so do not know How things are done in Toronto. As far as I know McMillan 's. are also in Canada. But you would have some organisation with which you can get in touch with. Fingers crossed things go well for your wife. Report thanks for the kind words, lets pray and hope for the best! Report Hi Janet and others, results were not good, malignant tumor. She is having a lumpectomy followed by 3-5 weeks of radiation on March 6th. If lymph nodes are involved then she will need chemo. Lets pray and hope for the best! I went through surgery and chemo 7 years ago for stage 3 colon cancer so I know what my wife is going through! Report So very sorry to hear that, how big was the Tumor? Did they say. This is a tough time for both of you. Will be thinking of you both. Until you get biopsy results it's a waiting game. Do let us know how you get on. Report She is going through menepause so her cycle is all screwed up, getting period every 2 weeks with painful boobs which is normal. Then in January she didnt get period for a month but during that time one breast was hurting her. She checked it and noticed a lump. On Feb 4th she had an ultrasound which showed a 2cm mass. I paid and booked our trip to Florida leaving Feb 10. On Feb 6th she gets a call from her doctor not the secretary asking my wife to have a fast track mammo and biopsy on same day, it was scheduled for Feb 12 so I moved our departure to 6 Feb 16. On Feb 17 in Florida my wife called the hospital that morning and scheduled an appointment for Feb 26th the day we would be back. They had told us that it would take 7 days for results and would not say anything when they called us. Late afternoon she gets a call from the hospital from another intern asking her to see her ASAP. My with told her we were not in Toronto and an appointment was booked for the 26th, she said that was too late! But we are in Florida my wife told her, I guess she thought about it and said, "ok Mrs. Schieda you enjoy the rest of your stay and we'll see you when you get back!" So we staid until 26th, obviously we had an idea of what the results were going to be! But we stuck it out for the 9 days in Florida as best as we could. We got back and you know the rest...malignant 2cm tumor...surgery this Friday and radiation to follow...hoping NO CHEMO!!! Report
Posts.Title: concerned husband

Posts.Content: My tumours were 3cm x 2 heading towards each other. Had a mastectomy and reconstruction. I am hear to tell the tale. 7 year course Of letrosole, cancer free. Please try and keep a positive outlook. Not easy to do. Report
Posts.Title: concerned husband

Posts.Content: Have you had chance to tell your mum yet? Report No, I just can't do it. Report I have to ask, when you say you "can`t do it" is it because by telling it will then lead you to seeing a doctor and that scares you?  Or can you not tell your Mum because you do not want to upset her.  If that is the case is there a friend that you can confide in? Once you have made the first step you will be on the right track to getting the help you may need.    Report Well your next option is to ring the doctors yourself. I know your scared but until you do something about your situation you have no answers. Your a young adult so you can do this. There are a number of conditions non are related to cancer. I take it you know your doctor, so you can go to the surgery or phone them up. Another option is a&e. Then there's the Macmillan help line. Report
Posts.Title: Unsure of what to do or who to tell

Posts.Content: Well your next option is to ring the doctors yourself. I know your scared but until you do something about your situation you have no answers. Your a young adult so you can do this. There are a number of conditions non are related to cancer. I take it you know your doctor, so you can go to the surgery or phone them up. Another option is a&e. Then there's the Macmillan help line. Report
Posts.Title: Unsure of what to do or who to tell

Posts.Content: Sorry if jumped to wrong conclusion. From UK so do not know How things are done in Toronto. As far as I know McMillan 's. are also in Canada. But you would have some organisation with which you can get in touch with. Fingers crossed things go well for your wife. Report
Posts.Title: concerned husband

Posts.Content: Try not to worry, that's hard I know. Do not try guessing what might be or not. You will have to be patient till you see him. How long till your appointment. They can 're call you for all sorts of things. Let us know how you get on and fingers crossed for a good outcome. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram re-call

Posts.Content: Totally understand that feeling. It's scary but you do not have a long wait. Make a note of any questions Yuri oh will want to ask. I hope you will have someone with you. Keep in touch. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram re-call

Posts.Content: Keep busy over the weekend, try to focus on something to do, the days are counting down for you. Let us know how you get on. Here to listen and help if we can. Report
Posts.Title: Mammogram re-call
